values:
Yay! 11:30 am and I was on the 2nd to last page of my 7-page lab report due at 1:30 today, when what do you know?, Fairfax lost power- for about an hour.  I responded immediately with  "oh, shit...", then a bit of tears.  Then came hopefulness that classes would be cancelled, then came mass hunger followed by disappointment since the food court was of course closed.  Then came Wajiha and Sasha "Rwar, let's get pho!" Me- "Rwar, nommies!"  Then came more disappointment as we drove up to the place and all the lights were out.  At this point brilliance was had, as we decided to try Lotte.  YAY! They were open and we could eat. Then Wajiha called her prof to see if lab was cancelled- "Rwar, u haf 2 come, AHAhAHahAHa!!!!!111 All power is on!!!!!!!111 ROFLROFLROFL."  And I cried..., on the inside- on the outside I looked like God gave me a big forehead and wideset eyes, but that's ok because my smiles come in a bright orange bottle with a child-safe cap.  When I got to lab the prof ran by "No classie, nooo classie!!!! But maybe classie!"  Then we had lecture in a musical chairs kinda-way, only with rooms instead of chairs.  Then a quizzie- I vomited on my paper and rolled only my face in it, since we weren't allowed to get up during the quizznit.  Then I say "Rwar, prof you stole my book!!!" Prof- "No bookie, noooo bookie!!! Maybe bookie, go ask Dr lab man ROFLROFLROFL!!!!111"  Me to Dr lab man- "Wan book now!" Dr lab man- "No" then "Maybe bookie, you follow me ALL over place, AHaHaha!!!111" No book found, so I went to my prof again- "I e-mail you till I get book back." Prof- "Here, have my bookie!!" Me- "Rwar, why not sooner?"

And so now I get to retype my whole lab, because the prof gave everybody a 1 week extension, but also said that now we have <u>3</u> lab reports due next week.  So yay!
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/22123.html

Yay! As you know, went to the BNL concert with Sasha.  I don't really like their music, but they always put on a really good show.  Of course, I had to go to school and the roundup before the concert, so I was really tired by the time we got home from it.  But Sasha didn't want to sleep yet, nooo, first we have to laugh at pr0n.  That was my first pr0n, and it seriously scarred me, and made me want to vomit at parts.
And the whole time from Sun to Tues I was house sitting for Dr M.  We watched pr0n on Dr M's TV!!!!!!!111 LOLOLOLOL!!!!!111
Anyway, about the roundup- yes, this was at Mike's family's farm- the roundup was to vaccinate all the cattle.  I mostly drew up vax's for the moomoos, which meant drawing up 12 cc's of molasses consistency Ivomec 300 times, along with the 2 other vax they get.  Plus I had to keep the records straight on which cows got what, what vial # their blood was, and whether or not they were pregnant (I was in class while the bulls were being done).  I stabbed myself with a used needle by accident and couldn't wash my hands for 2 hours, since we were deep in the fields.  And of course, being so deep in the fields we were ankle deep in meadow muffins most of the time.  So now my finger is swollen and my thumb is bruised and my shoes are stinky.  But I had a hellagood time.
Needless to say I should have showered before the concert, but traffic was really bad and I got home late, so I didn't have time or we'd miss the concert.  Anyway, much fun was had with Sasha at the concert.  Tuesday I went to class and left early for the roundup again.  We finished the whole farm by 4:30.  And then I slept.  I didn't go to classes yesterday- because I slept!  I came home from work yesterday- and SLEPT!  I wish I was sleeping now.
BTW Megann and Sasha, thank you for visiting my site ^_^.  And also, I've always wanted to do a Rainbow Bright cosplay too.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/21875.html

yay! since sasha thinks I'm not random enough in my posts and that I talk about school too much, here goes idle blather:

I'm wearing my sister's lime green sweater today- I didn't know if it was clean or dirty when I put it on, but I think it doesn't smell, so it was prolly clean.

I was late for class today because I went 1/2way down my street to the highway, when I realized I'd forgotten my cell phone and Sasha wouldn't be able to contact me for lunch.  So I turned around and got it, but it wasn't very useful, was it?  Please, Sasha- don't think I'm being bitter to you- just trying to be random for you.

I think I'm the only one who has visited my website since I put it up.  I feel like I'm ballot-box stuffing every time I visit it and the counter goes up.  Then again, the counter doesn't really work anyway.

And just to complete my entry- I got a low "B" on the organic exam that made me cry (only because everyone else failed too), I got a mid "B" on my plant bio exam, and a high "C" on my geog exam that I didn't even know we were having (since I had skipped so many classes).  I still have to apply for my gov. aid for this year.  And I still have to talk to my advisor before I can register, which is bad, since reg. started yesterday.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/21504.html

I have class in 30 min and a paper to rewrite before then.  After class I have to write out -2- prelabs for my organic lab this afternoon.  We're making up for the day we missed b/c of the hurricane- which sucks b/c I'll prolly have to be there for the whole 4 hours at least, and maybe more.  Poop.

Lately I've been feeling so stressed and overworked- it's like all my life is spent just passing the time because I don't even know what's going on anymore.  And speaking of overworked, tomorrow marks my 6th Saturday in a row having to work.  Thankfully I have next weekend off, but I'll prolly be at Dr M's house dog-sitting, so its not really time off.  I just want one day of vegetative bliss.  I won't even have a restful Thanksgiving break- I'll be having my wisdom teeth pulled.  Aaaaagh, I just want to cry.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/21497.html

want nommies! In other news, I believe I just failed my Organic Chem exam. I hope everyone else did too- that way there will be a curve! I cried, I self-pitied, and now I self-loath! Yay, yay, happy, HApPy! f@ck8n b/tch&s. YAY! And I have updated my webby, not that any of you probably cares- mostly con pic updates and some band pic updates. If you DO happen to visit it- please lemme know what you think- thanx ^__^
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/21025.html

What Irrational Number Are You?
You are φ

Of all the irrational numbers, you are considered to be the most beautiful. Those who know you well have called you by many names, all golden. However, most people don't know you by name and probably won't even recognize you by sight, but they do like to see you. Despite your pretty face, you are by no means shallow. You are involved in many things: finance, biology, architecture, art, music, and much more.

In some ways you and e are a nearly perfect match. The power and intensity of e excites you.

Your lucky number is approximately 1.61803399

Shiny Lemur
Straif's Blog

What Kind Of Angel Are You?( Anime Pics )
brought to you by Quizilla I'm happy. Why you ask? Because I got my bio exam back and I got a 98 woot! woot! :jive monkey dancin': So yes, I'm happy, but that will only last a few more hours, since I have a huge Organic exam to study for that's on Monday. I must get an A on it, since there are only 2 more, and there is no opportunity to change my grade otherwise- and I got a C on the first one :(
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/20852.html

Started Fri. night-
 Pre-dinner for the family and friends of Whitestone Farm (Mike's family's farm) which I arrived at  1 1/2 hours late b/c of work (last appt. was a broken toe which needed x-rays and a splint).  The food Mike set aside for me was pretty good, the dancing was -interesting-, and it was pretty fun overall... except for George, Mike's 53 yr old millionaire cousin.  My family thinks he has some mental/developmental problems, b/c he gets on a subject and just harps on it, no matter how uncomfortable or inappropriate it is- like trying to play Mike over foozball to win ME as the prize for the night (all this infront of my PARENTS no less)! And George kept telling me he was going to bring Mike with him to the next -wet bikini- contest he was judging, and that I should compete.  Elgh! you sick, pampered, rich-bitch, chouvanistic, war-mongrel. Why the HELL would you say that? Anyway, I was a little more rude than the situation warrented, but that was b/c of the -one- drink I had that some how f*ed me up.  Since I couldn't drive home, I spent the night at Mike's parent's house.

Sat. morning-
 I woke up around 7:30, thought it was 8:30, and drove back to my house (10 min drive) to shower and change for the sale.  Got back to the farm, and basically everything was already hectic.  I parked cars for about 1 1/2 hours till the vet got there and the sale actually started.  Then I did some data entry for a bit, and then doc and I got down to business writing out health certificates for the animals as they were sold.  The selling was western auction style and 198 animals were sold individually within 3.6 hours.  Doc an' I were there till 7 (3 extra hours) trying to sort out and double check everything, mostly b/c his dumbass, uncooth, unhelpful "assistants" were nowhere to be found.  Ergh.
Thankfully, everyone decided to go out for din-din to celebrate such a good sale, which was great since I hadn't eaten since breakfast.  We invited my mom (but not my dad, since he's an ass and has alienated himself from Mike's family, what with that whole kicking Mike out of the house thing).  We went to this little place in Leesburg called the Eiffel Tower that's pretty damn nice for what looks like a hole-in-the-wall kinda joint. George -had- to mention playing for me again, infront of my mother- again.  Much champaigne and wine and liquer-pickled strawberries were consumed.  One nice thing to say about George- he decided to cover the tab at the restaurant.  I slept over at the farm again ^_^

Sun. morning-
 AAAGGHH!  I have so much HW to do!
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/20688.html

You are Form 8, Demon: The Destroyer. "And The Demon took advantage of the chaos
and seized civillization. With grace and
style, Demon slit The Goddess's belly and
drowned the world in her blood. The Goddess,
The Demon, and the world were no
more." Some examples of the Demon Form are Seth (Egyptian)
and The Horsemen of the Apocalypse (Christian). The Demon is associated with the concept of
destruction, the number 8, and the element of
earth. His sign is the full moon. As a member of Form 8, you are a very strong willed
individual. You don't let others' opinions
sway your own and you're usually not afraid to
speak your mind. However, some may see you as
a bit overly passionate but it's just because
you never back down from your values. No
matter what, you always do everything with
style. Demons are the best friends to have
because they will back you up.

Which Mythological Form Are You?
brought to you by Quizilla I think I pushed too many buttons... This is my result when I only chose 1 thing from each question:
You are Form 1, Goddess: The Creator. "And The Goddess planted the acorn of life.
She cried a single tear and shed a single drop
of blood upon the earth where she buried it.
From her blood and tear, the acorn grew into
the world." Some examples of the Goddess Form are Gaia (Greek),
Jehova (Christian), and Brahma (Indian). The Goddess is associated with the concept of
creation, the number 1, and the element of
earth. Her sign is the dawn sun. As a member of Form 1, you are a charismatic
individual and people are drawn to you.
Although sometimes you may seem emotionally
distant, you are deeply in tune with other
people's feelings and have tremendous empathy.
Sometimes you have a tendency to neglect your
own self. Goddesses are the best friends to
have because they're always willing to help.

Which Mythological Form Are You?
brought to you by Quizilla Anywho, I think I'm going to have to skip turning in today's homework for bio lab, since apparently I still have to wait 197 minutes 'til the search for my DNA sequence is done, and class starts in 33 minutes. Whoops. I'm gonna try to upload some more con pics to my website today. I think they're the A-kon 14 ones I have with me.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/20478.html

yay! an update!  ok, so maybe it's not so exciting for you.

well, my sis is in the bahama's with her boyfriend, my mom is in miami, and i'm stuck at home with my nana and father (whom i recently told "...if it makes you mad then, fuck yeah i'll do it!").  slightly tense at home.  been doing crazy amounts of house work lately, very little studying.  i NEED to study since i have 2 exams in the next 2 days.  i think i'll do well regardless.  organic is beginning to scare the shit outta me- i still haven't bought the book or model set or practice exams or work book ;_;  so overwhelming!

um, megann/ sasha, i remember your cos' have wings, but mine doesn't- at least in the char. sketch.  even if she does, i don't really wanna make them.  and for the instruments- you could prabaly find used ones at goodwill or ebay or someplace so you wouldn't have to make them.

does anyone know the lyrics for "greensleeves", the old hymn/ work song?  or where to find them?  thnx!

and today i get to face dawn about an altercation with one of the kennel kids a few days ago.  i don't know if she's even taking it seriously, but if she is... she can have quite the temper.  i don't think she would have acted any differently though if she were in the same situation.

ergph- need nommies...
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/20171.html

...or something like that...

well, here we go, for the 1st time in 2 or 3 months:

1, it is my 21st b-day this sunday, but since a night of drinking is not cool on a sunday, i'll go out on sat. with as many of my friends as can come, and some people i don't know.  if you are free this weekend, like to drink, and know who i am, then please gimme a call or email.  the more the merrier!

2, classes are reasonably hard this semester.  actaully, for 2 of my classes i still haven't bought the books yet.  this could have been a huge problem this week since i had an exam in every class this week on every day.  thankfully, i got a "B" on every one of them.  pretty good for not even being able to read what we're being tested on.

3, for those who know her, my mom had back surgery last thursday.  it went well, and she's able to walk in short doses now.  she doesn't have to be back to work for another 2 weeks, which is good because she's still in a lot of pain.  but she was stupid and didn't take the antibiotics they Rx'ed her, which were at a really heavy dose, so you know the docs meant business.  it ends up that she got a huge infection inside her cheek causing it to puff up real big.  and that's because her immune system is so impaired after this taxing surgery. stupeed.

4, i think i wish there was a 4, or a spoon

5, i haven't raped borders in a very long time- i feel the craving so strongly.  datda, we have to go soon!

6, this week was hell, and i'll be glad when it's over.  3 exams, 2 labs, 1 5-page paper, work this sat. morn.  i can't wait for sat night when i finally get to let loose and party a little.

ok, i'll try to be more regular with my posting again, but it won't be more than once a week.  i don't have the time anymore ^_^
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/19847.html

For some reason that phrase has been stuck in my head for the past 3 days.  Well, Mike and I had our first dance lesson last night.  Its a 4-week program, 1 hour a week, 1 dance a week.  This week was the foxtrot.  Its a rather boring unnatural dance.  Mike has never danced a day in his life, so he was doing pretty awefully.  And he got embarresed about it too, so that didn't make things any easier for him.  He told me he felt like never going back, but that he REALLY wanted to do this for me so we could dance together.  So sweet ^___^

In other news, the webby is progressing nicely.  I wonder if Megann is checking out yahoo domains for the new page?  My sis downloaded "big butts" onto her cell for a ringer.  It's pretty funny, cuz everyone in the room stops to find where its coming from and if it's really what they think they're hearing.  Ah, 80's rap, we shalt never forget thee.  I really wanna download some j-rock rings.  Speaking of j-rock, I have recently realized my lovce of Luna Sea, though I've had the CD for almost 2 years now. 

AND, one last thing, my mom found Reneissance Man on DVD and bought it for me.  I don't know why, but I really love that movie.

off to more work on the webby, then work.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/19660.html

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

OrliLover- Fri, Aug 8, 2003 at 10:40 PM EDT 

OMG I HAVE SEEN THE MOVIE POTC 3 TIMES! IT WAS EXCITING AND FULL OF ACTION AND LOTS OF HOTTIES, (WELL JOHNNY AND ORLANDO!) I JUST LOVE THIS MOVIE AND I THINK THAT IT DESERVES AN A+ FOR SURE!!! I WILL MARRY ORLANDO BLOOM ONE DAY!!!I AM NOT LYING EITHER! yeah i wish

Again, I say, FREAK!
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/19406.html

well, let's see- I believe it's been a month since my last update.  and almost as long since the last time I read my friends' lj's.

right now I'm taking a dreadful advanced english composition class.  I hate english in the 1st place, but to have to take a full-credits advanced class in 5 weeks- it's torture.  and not helping my GPA.  i'll probably only take 3 classes next semester, but it'll still count as full-time since they're all 4 credits (and have a 3 hr lab each week for all of them).

um, don't know if anyone remembers, but my g-pa has been in really bad shape for the past 2 months- stokes, liver and kidney failure...  well, the docs in the ICU (where he's been for the past 5 weeks) said he would pass away this last thursday.  but he's still alive, quite to the amazement of everyone.  some say you get better right before you get worse.  he's looking like he'll be around for a while though ^_^ (apparently his lungs have taken over the filtering work that his kidney's had done- suctioning a <u>gallon</u> from his lungs everyday)

um, still going out with mike, and happy.  he's playing alot of gigs lately, like tonight- grog n tankard.  i hope they make it big.

ugh!  last night/ this morning at 4am i was awoken by my cell phone ringing- it was kevin, who hasn't called me and barely IMed me in the past 3 months since school's out, saying he was going to leave me a message.  why???  why at 4am???  why not call when i'll answer?  ugh!  but i'm not too mad- it's nice to talk to him once in a while.  i really miss him actually.

and... (trumpets, drum roll) i got a new cell phone today from my mom, since the last one just kinda went kaplooey.  cute little samsung phlip-fone ^___^

last weekend sasha, michelle, and i went to KD- much fun had, many old rides i'd never been on were riden.  much fooling of ashley was done.  also some de-hydration.  yay!  yay for wet street-clothes too!  and especially visors in the bright sun.

had 5 baby bunnies- turned them over to wildlife rescue, 4 died.  haven't called about the last one cuz he was my fav and if i don't call and find out he's gone, then it's like he's still alive.  want a bunnie now to keep.  too many animals already, though.

um, all for now- want something to talk aout next time.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/18733.html

the entire remainder of this entry will be written with tacito in one hand, leaving only five fingers to type with.  wait, I lied, here comes a rib.  left over mexican from last night.  although, he's a little bit greasier today.

i saw the snapple commercial with the guinea pigs-as-bulls for the first time yesterday.  oh, so funny!  and cute, in an odd way o.0

hmm, again, much has happened since my last post (though that's kinda *duh* since i don't post very often). a-kon has come and gone, and no one who was originally going went.  which means that it's that time of year agian- time to buy fabric and start making my next costume.  i feel like going goth/glam/lolita this time.  if i can't find something suitable i'll do something of my own creation. but being recognized is always more fun.

anywho, my grandfather was just admitted to the hosp last night- we thought he had suffered another stroke because of how bad his speech was slurred.  it turns out that he actually has a pretty bad case of pnuemonia with secondary severely high blood pressure.  the slurring of his speech was due to the high blood pressure not getting enough O2 to his brain, so if left untreated, he actually COULD have had a stroke by midnight or early this morning.  i think we're getting to the scary stage in my grandparents' lives- the one where you become really aware of how little time is left to be with them.

well, on a less depressing note- 2 week old kitens with severe upper respiratory infections and heavy flea infestation are SOOOOOOOOOOO CUTE! one of our techs took her in to nurse her back to health instead of letting her be euthanized.  when she's all better she'll be up for adoption.  she's a calico, and her ears look like little round teddy bear ears, and she makes the tiniest liitle mews. agh, she's so cute.  i got to feed her twice yesterday- from a syringe- while she clawwed the heck out of my hand kneading on it.  ^_^

i have also discovered that my mom's laptop has a version of photshop on it (elements) that really has all i need to do the kind of work that i do.  only problem is that i want it on the home pc- is it possible to copy the program to disk and use it that way on the home pc?

and now i realize that it's 2p and i have to run to get to work.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/18528.html

well, we are back from seeing my aunt in NC.  we were supposed to get the results of her tests while we were there, but the doc called to say it wouldn't be till this friday, so, yeah...  I had no idea she had so many animals- 4 dogs, 8 cats (3 are kittens), 2 horses, and 17 chickens.  and in a few months her backyard will be a wildlife refuge.  while we were down there my mom and I got really attached to one of the kittens, so after she is spayed we'll have a new addition to our family.  when she gets here, all are welcome to visit her!

in other news, I'm very sick.  very, very, very sick- and I keep getting random nose bleeds many times a day.  I have to go to work today, since I haven't been since last weds, but I'll wear a surgical mask so no one else will get sick.

the picture lady called us yesterday, left a message.  I think the proofs are ready.  I should call her now.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/18228.html

last night i saw the Matrix Reloaded junx.  since I went in knowing that it would end up being continued and had been told that there was alot of convo, I was prepped for what everyone else was disappointed by.  I loved it.  the 1st one was cool and could stand on its own 2 feet, but this one was much more intellectual- much interesting convo was had after the movie too.  sasha- did you catch that the chinese fighter in white in the french guy's palace was one of the guys from Bishounen?  he was the cute little clingy one.
anywho, leaving for Baba's in a few hours, and I still have to visit my nana for her b-day -_-; oh yeah, and pack.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/17971.html

i just had 2 bowls of special k for breakfast, and my mouth tastes like beef-n-broccoli.  hmm.

i'm sure most of my friends don't know or care who jerry stackhouse is, but we groomed his dog yesterday at the clinic.  big black german sheperd.  stackhouse plays for the wizards btw.

tomorrow is my nana's b-day, and the day after is my mom and dad's anniversary.  but we'll be in NC taking care of my aunt so i don't think it'll be much of an ann. for them.  i found out last night that i'll be giving my aunt's horses their shots while i'm there too (this is cool to me).  and here is an interesting thought- if she can't walk, and her daughter is leaving when we get down there, does that mean we'll be mucking stalls and brushing horsies and all that other equine stuff i really don't know a hoot about?  oh dear.  and i still have to pack- woops!

agh!  i just remembered i still have to cancel my a-kon hotel reservations!  i'm so bummed we can't go, but it ends up that it didn't work out for any of us.

you know what would be awesome?  if i had a pc with a pentium 4, and t1 line.  then everything would be so much quicker.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/17729.html

i love not going to school. it makes everything so much easier. i even willingly did chores which are not my responsibility this morning! 
anywho, much fun was had yesterday with sasha and matt p.  i brought over my sketchbook, but the movies absorbed my attention, so no drawings done. happy tree friends- on crack, on LOTS of crack, futurama- rocks as only matt groenings' shtuff can, and fruits basket- i love all males in that series and her 2 girl friends, but i hate her! "oh, i'm so sweet, i always think of you and what is proper to say and do in this situation, and of course everyone loves me!"  it's almost a mary sue. but i do like the show a lot. to matt- i'm sorry i was so quiet last night, i just clam up when i hang out with people i usually don't hang out with.
in other news, and far less happy, and rather eerie, considering what megann told me a few days ago- - my mom told me this morning that we were going to go visit my aunt in NC this weekend.  naturally this made me happy, since she's my favorite aunt of all.  then my mom told me why.  baba (we call her that for short - barbara) is in a lot of pain lately.  especially in her left leg.  in the bone.  today she's having a lot of testing done- blood, marrow, bone density.  we're pretty sure its cancer, and now we're just hoping its luekemia rather than osteosarcoma.  she's been living out of her bed, with her oldest daughter (33) helping her out.  her youngest son (8) and daughter (14) are now living with her 2nd oldest daughter (28), because she can't take care of them at all. btw, baba has 6 kids. anyway, we hope to spend the weekend with her and support her and her family where we can.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/17486.html

I am a giant mutant kitten. I have already eaten the butler and cook- next is the baby. Mwahaahaa!

Which cute or possibly strange kitten are you?
brought to you by Quizilla MWAHAAHAA!
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/17383.html

hella-yeah.  5 weeks of freedom, then it'll be ass-kickin adv comp (i HATE english classes, texts, teachers...).
so, just got out of bio final, and i think i did pretty well.  will meet with bio prof in about 1 1/2 hours.  and that's it for this semester- there is nothing i can do which will lower or raise my grade- which is a comforting thought- closure and all.
hooray for mommies- i can have lunch today!  i feel like such a kindergartner, asking for lunch money.  and since i had breakfast at 4:30am, i think i'll eat lunch now.
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/17069.html

had another final today- it 103.  easy.  should have studied for bio, but instead i've spent the past 3 hours playing around on various very good duel jewel sites.  i am influenced to change the layout of my dj section on my site.  that won't happen for a while though.  i'm hungry and i have $1.25 to my name.  and that has to last till thursday.  i'll prolly bum off my parents, since my sister stole $5 from me and they generally take responsibility for her.  agh, must remember to pay tuition today before i leave campus!  and call doc for appt., and do my laundry when i get home, since i have no more clean scrub pants after today.  i feel like i'm forgetting something.

i was told last weekend that i remind [a certain person] of the lead character in a clockwork orange.  i don't believe that is a compliment.  they said they could easily see me as a caniving, destructive demon of a person.  o.0
http://satomi-gnt.livejournal.com/16757.html

well, interesting weekend it was.
1st, ditched jay on friday to hang with sasha, steph, michelle, and alexis.  i feel bad about it, but at the same time, we were going to go to a club and go dancing, and i had a HUGE nausiating migrain.  and pounding music and flashing lights and smoke are not too good for that.  so instead we all went to denny's.  many hours of fun.
sat morning i had to work.  i was annoyed most of the day, though because tiffany was being pretty pissy and treating me like i'd never even drawn up a vaccine before. on second thought, i need a cough drop. i'm sitting here hacking my lungs up, getting nothing but a hoarse throat to show for it. yup, still sick. thought it'd be over by now. i wore a skirt for the first time this year today. kinda liberating- feeling the sun on your legs and all. not wearing shorts cuz they show more leg than a skirt, and i'm at school and feel weird about wearing shorts to school. if it gets hot enough i'm sure i'll get over that.

anywho- monday at work was very interesting. 1st of all, usually the clinic brings in about $4k a day- on monday it was $8k, and it really felt like it. emergencies up the wazoo. one of which was a cat who had been in labor for over 16 hours and had only had 1 kitten. x-ray revealed 7 more still in. did emergency surgery- cut her uteris right out- and all the kittens were born with heart beats, but very cold. we all sat there for about 2 hours rubbing them, breathing into them, and doing something that looks alot like you're slamming the poor dears into the ground (trying to move the fluid out of their lungs so they could breath). when they left they were all still living, but i doubt more than 2 actually survived the night. it all felt pretty rewarding though.

yep, it was THAT good.  one thing i must get out of the way first though- I HATE FUCKING BALTIMORE!!!!!!!  all done.

so yesterday- after getting to baltimore at approximately 4:53pm, we (mike and i) drove around for about 20 min trying to find the road that the restaurant was on.  eventually just decided to park in a garage and try and find it on foot, since balmor is horrible about one way streets.  walked about 15 blocks in a circle (while being aambushed by loud abusive homeless men), till we finally happened to see a small sign advertising the restaurant down a street with no street signs- yea that was the street we had been trying to find in the car too.
well, once we got there- Ruth's Chris Steakhouse- what can i say?  it was another world.  absolutely beautiful atmosphere, very courteous and prompt service, and oh my heavenly buddha- the food was ecstacy in every bite.  like butta.  mmmm.  after a long dinner, and complimentary fudge cheese cake w/ raspberry sauce and garnish, we decided to head to the next attration for the evening- le cirque du soleil, Dralion.  this too was a surprise for mike.  since parking is a bitch in balmor, we thought it'd be better to walk to where ever we were going.  ended up being another 20 blocks- think about 3 blocks before the ESPN zone to about 7 blocks after the hotel that katsucon was at in 2002.
ANYWAY, the circus was absolutely amazing.  its great on TV, but a 13" screen can do no justice to their magic.  every moment you were on the edge of your seat with baited breath, praying that everything would go allright in every stunt.  which, of course, it did because these people are extremely talented and dedicated.  picked up the soundtrack to another one of their circus'- Alegria, my favorite one- beautiful voice that woman has.  one of my favorite acts (in both circus' i've mentioned, actually) involves a person being suspended from the center of the tent on a long sash of fabric, held up by their own strength.  its so incredibly graceful, they look like they're flying, or soaring like an etherial being.  aahhh...., how lovely.

ok, that is all for now.  oh, and i'm getting sick- sore throat, runny nose, sneezes...

yep, got up at 6 am, which used to be 5 am, got ready and met kevin at metro station at 8:15 to go to natnl zoo for the animal bio field trip.  s-s-soo-o f-f-frick-kin' c-c-co-old-d!!  i really like some of the exhibits, but some are outdated seeming, and alot are too small.  i feel sorry for most of the animals there.  i did, however like:

1. cheetahs, cuz they're basically my favorite animal, or foxes, both very stiking in beauty

2. amazonia, which was hard to access due to renovations of one the houses right in front of it.  so we had to walk about 1/2 mile just to get to the exhibit, which was fine, until what happened in that exhibit.  coming down the inside stairs, looking for poisen dart frogs, and kevin makes a joke- it was a stupid joke, but apparently funny enough for me to forget about the stairs.  i fell, twisted BOTH my ankles, and really bruised my bum. ~ embarassing  ^_^; ~ thankfully the ankle-twisting wasn't very bad, so after about 10 min of sitting on the stairs i was able to walk again.  but, oy, the pain!  i was limping pretty badly the rest of the trip.  kevin and i gimped around together for about 2 hours more, and by the time we left for home, both of us were in a lot of pain.
still a very nice exhibit, though.

i just don't see the draw of the pandas- sure they're really cute looking, but ALL they do is sit on their asses and eat bamboo.

one of the more odd things today- at the wolf exhibit, everyone was saying they couldn't see any of the wolves.  walking a little further along, a zoo keeper could be seen asking children if they would like to pet the skin of a wolf, that just happened to be lying over the railing to their enclosure.  internal dialogue: ~so this is what they did with the animals that died a few days ago!~

i almost vomited in the arthropod house. they had a huge corner of one room designated as the "golden-orb spider webs", which of course had about 20 of the creeps in it.  ugh!!! and you have to walk past them to get out, which i had to do twice since we missed something on our first trip through.

over-all, though, a very nice time was had.

now must do massiva amounts of homework.
